intro: Coelospermum kanehirae, commonly known as the Kaneshirae balsam, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream sides. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
